tit.e: Chodai (a room or a place to sleep especially built for nobilities)
Chodai (a room or a place to sleep especially built for nobilities)
Chodai (a room or a place to sleep especially built for nobilities)

sen.j: 帳台（ちょうだい）は、貴人の座所や寝所として置かれた8尺四方のテント型の目隠し。
sen.e: Chodai is a tent-shaped screen with about 242 square centimeters which was built as a nobility's living room or bedroom.
Chodai is a tent-shaped screen with about 242 square centimeters which was built as a nobility's living room or bedroom.
Chodai is a tent-shaped screen with about 242 square centimeters which was built as a nobility's living room or bedroom.

sen.j: 御帳台（みちょうだい）、御帳とも。
sen.e: It was also called michodai or micho.
It was also called michodai or micho.
It was also called michodai or micho.

sen.j: 四隅に置いた「土居（つちい）」という土台の上に高さ6尺7寸の柱3本を立てるので全体の高さは7尺1寸である。
sen.e: Its overall height is about 215 cm because three pillars about 203 cm in height are set on a foundation called 'tsuchii' laid on each of the four corners.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its overall height is about 215 cm because three pillars about 203 cm in height are set on a foundation called 'tsuchii' laid on each of the four corners.
Its overall height is about 215 cm because three pillars about 203 cm in height are set on a foundation called 'tsuchii' laid on each of the four corners.

sen.j: 「鴨居」と呼ばれる横木を渡して、桟が漆塗りの明障子（あかりしょうじ）を乗せる。
sen.e: A bar called 'kamoi' is laid over the pillars, and akari-shoji (a translucent screen or sliding door made by pasting single sheets of white Japanese paper) with lacquered frame is put on the top of it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A bar called 'kamoi' is laid over the pillars, and akari-shoji (a translucent screen or sliding door made by pasting single sheets of white Japanese paper) with a lacquered frame is put on the top of it.

A bar called 'kamoi' is laid over the pillars, and akari-shoji (a translucent screen or sliding door made by pasting single sheets of white Japanese paper) with a lacquered frame is put on the top of it.

sen.j: 4幅の帳を四隅に、5幅の帳を四方の中ほどにそれぞれに別に垂らした。
sen.e: Drapes about 150 cm in size are hung down from the four corners, and another drapes about 190 cm in size are separately hung down in the middle of each of the four faces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処1幅は約38cmで換算しました。
sen.e: Drapes about 150 cm in size are hung down from the four corners, and other drapes about 190 cm in size are separately hung down in the middle of each of the four faces.
Drapes about 150 cm in size are hung down from the four corners, and other drapes about 190 cm in size are separately hung down in the middle of each of the four faces.

sen.j: 帳台を立てると、東西と南の側と浜床に3尺の几帳を立てて目隠しにする。
sen.e: After the chodai is built up, about 90 cm-high kicho (a curtained frame put up to screen royal personages or noble ladies from direct view of those around them) is stood up as a screen on each face of east, west and south and on hamayuka (a low podium).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the chodai is built up, about 90 cm-high kicho (a curtained frame put up to screen royal personages or noble ladies from direct view of those around them) is stood up as a screen on each face of east, west and south and on hamayuka (a low podium).

After the chodai is built up, about 90 cm-high kicho (a curtained frame put up to screen royal personages or noble ladies from direct view of those around them) is stood up as a screen on each face of east, west and south and on hamayuka (a low podium).

sen.j: 几帳を置いた側の帳はやはり3尺ほど巻き上げ、壁代のように内外の紐で結び止める。
sen.e: The drapes of the faces on which the kicho is set up are rolled up for about 90 cm and held by tying with strings from inside and outside just like kabeshiro (hangings used as a blind in a nobleman's residence).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The drapes of the faces on which the kicho is set up are rolled up for about 90 cm and held by tying strings from inside and outside just like kabeshiro (hangings used as a blind in a nobleman's residence).

The drapes of the faces on which the kicho is set up are rolled up for about 90 cm and held by tying strings from inside and outside just like kabeshiro (hangings used as a blind in a nobleman's residence).

sen.j: 北と四隅の帳は垂らしたままにしておく。
sen.e: The other drapes on the north face and the four corners are left hanging down.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The other drapes on the north face and the four corners are left hanging down.
The other drapes on the north face and the four corners are left hanging down.

sen.j: （使用者は南枕に寝る）
sen.e: (Sleepers must lie with their head southward.)
(Sleepers must lie with their head southward.)
(Sleepers must lie with their head southward.)

sen.j: 寝床には、皇后の場合のみ「浜床（はまゆか）」という高さ1尺、四方9尺の黒塗りの台を置く。
sen.e: Only in case of a bedroom for the empress, a black-lacquered podium called 'hamayuka', which size is 30 cm high and 273 cm square, is set up on the floor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Only in the case of a bedroom for the empress, a black-lacquered podium called 'hamayuka,' whose size is 30 cm high and 273 cm square, is set up on the floor.
Only in the case of a bedroom for the empress, a black-lacquered podium called 'hamayuka,' whose size is 30 cm high and 273 cm square, is set up on the floor.

sen.j: 皇后以外は板敷きの上に南北に土敷という繧繝縁の畳2帖を敷く。
sen.e: In the case the bedroom for others, 2 jo (176x176 cm) of tsuchishiki, which is a type of tatami mat with ungenberi-rim, is laid on boarding floor in a meridional direction.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処帖の定訳不明です。
sen.e: In the case the bedroom for others, two jo (176x176 cm) of tsuchishiki, which is a type of tatami mat with ungenberi-rim, is laid on the boarding floor in a meridional direction.
In the case the bedroom for others, two jo (176x176 cm) of tsuchishiki, which is a type of tatami mat with ungenberi-rim, is laid on the boarding floor in a meridional direction.

sen.j: この上に、まず表筵（うわむしろ）を敷く。
sen.e: On the surface of that, uwamushiro (a matting laid on the tatami mats in chodai) is spread out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the surface of that, uwamushiro (a matting laid on the tatami mats in chodai) is spread out.
On the surface of that, uwamushiro (a matting laid on the tatami mats in chodai) is spread out.

sen.j: その上から「竜鬚の地舗（りょうびんのじしき）」という色とりどりに染めたイグサで織った筵に青い縁を縫ったもの、「茵」（しとね）と言って畳を芯にした綿入れの座布団、枕几帳、沈の枕、夜具を置く。
sen.e: Furthermore, 'ryobin no jishiki', which is a blue-trimmed mat woven with soft rush dyed in various colors, and 'shitone', which is wedded zabuton (traditional Japanese cushions used to sit on the floor) with interlining made of tatami, makuragicho (a small kicho screen set by the bedside), chinnomakura (a pillow made with eagle-wood) and bedclothes are placed thereupon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, 'ryobin no jishiki', which is a blue-trimmed mat woven with soft rush dyed in various colors, and 'shitone,' which is wedded zabuton (traditional Japanese cushions used to sit on the floor) with interlining made of tatami, makuragicho (a small kicho screen set by the bedside), chinnomakura (a pillow made with eagle-wood) and bedclothes are placed thereupon.

Furthermore, 'ryobin no jishiki', which is a blue-trimmed mat woven with soft rush dyed in various colors, and 'shitone,' which is wedded zabuton (traditional Japanese cushions used to sit on the floor) with interlining made of tatami, makuragicho (a small kicho screen set by the bedside), chinnomakura (a pillow made with eagle-wood) and bedclothes are placed thereupon.

sen.j: 向かって手前側の柱二本には上から1尺ほどの位置に肘金（Ｌ字フック）を打ち付ける。
sen.e: Hijikane (an "L" hook) is hammered into the point about 30 cm below the top of each of the two pillars on the nearer side as one faces the chodai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hijikane (an "L" hook) is hammered into the point about 30 cm below the top of each of the two pillars on the closer side as one faces the chodai.
Hijikane (an "L" hook) is hammered into the point about 30 cm below the top of each of the two pillars on the closer side as one faces the chodai.

sen.j: 「御角」（みつの）と呼ばれる銀の網を掛け、波模様を彫った桑の木で犀角をかたどった水難避けの護符を掛ける。
sen.e: A silver net called 'mitsuno' and gofu (talisman) in the shape of rhinoceros made out of mulberry trees with waved patterns carved on it, which is used as protection against floods, are hung from the hooks.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処原文では「御角」の意味が間違っていると思われますが、そのまま訳しました。
sen.e: A silver net called 'mitsuno' and gofu (talisman) in the shape of rhinoceros made out of mulberry trees with waved patterns carved on it, which is used as protection against floods, are hung from the hooks.

A silver net called 'mitsuno' and gofu (talisman) in the shape of rhinoceros made out of mulberry trees with waved patterns carved on it, which is used as protection against floods, are hung from the hooks.

sen.j: 反対側の柱の左右にも同じようにして、八角形の魔除けの鏡をかける。
sen.e: In the same way, another hooks are driven into the same points of the both pillars on the opposite side, and octagonal mirrors charmed to avert evil are hung from them.
In the same way, other hooks are driven into the same points of both pillars on the opposite side, and octagonal mirrors charmed to avert evil are hung from them.
In the same way, other hooks are driven into the same points of both pillars on the opposite side, and octagonal mirrors charmed to avert evil are hung from them.

sen.j: 天皇･皇后の場合は、帳の前、左に重石の獅子（黄色で口を開いている）を置いた。
sen.e: In case of the chodai for the emperor and the empress, a weight of Shishi lion (yellow-colored and with opened maw) is placed on the front end of left side drape.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For chodai for the emperor and the empress, a weight of Shishi lion (yellow-colored and with opened maw) is placed on the front end of left side drape.
For chodai for the emperor and the empress, a weight of Shishi lion (yellow-colored and with opened maw) is placed on the front end of left side drape.

sen.j: 右に狛犬（額に角があり、白で口を閉じている）を置いた。
sen.e: Another weight of komainu (white-colored, with closed maw and with a horn on the forehead) is placed on the front end of right side drape.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Another weight of komainu (white-colored, with closed maw and with a horn on the forehead) is placed on the front end of the right side drape.
Another weight of komainu (white-colored, with closed maw and with a horn on the forehead) is placed on the front end of the right side drape.

sen.j: いずれも金銅製で、その形については、神代紀の火須勢理命の故事にちなむという。
sen.e: The both are gilt bronze-made and those shapes are said to be associated with a tale of Hosuseri no mikoto (a Japanese ancient god who was born in flame) that appears Jindaiki (Records of period of gods).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The both are gilt bronze-made and those shapes are said to be associated with a tale of Hosuseri no mikoto (a Japanese ancient god who was born in flame) that appears in Jindaiki (Records of period of gods).

The both are gilt bronze-made and those shapes are said to be associated with a tale of Hosuseri no mikoto (a Japanese ancient god who was born in flame) that appears in Jindaiki (Records of period of gods).

sen.j: また、狛犬は麒麟で、金麟金獅子を鎮子とするのは唐の則天武后の例によるという。
sen.e: It is also said that the komainu stands for Kirin, and using a golden kirin and a golden shishi lion as ornamental weights is following a precedent of the Empress Sokuten in Tang (China).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also said that the komainu stands for Kirin, and using a golden kirin and a golden shishi lion as ornamental weights is following a precedent of the Empress Sokuten in Tang (China).
It is also said that the komainu stands for Kirin, and using a golden kirin and a golden shishi lion as ornamental weights is following a precedent of the Empress Sokuten in Tang (China).

sen.j: しかし、これらは判然としない。
sen.e: However, there is no solid foundation for these perceptions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, there is no solid foundation for these perceptions.
However, there is no solid foundation for these perceptions.

sen.j: 藤井高尚「松の落葉」によれば、「江家次第」立后の条に「師子形二」「師子形（二）御帳南面左右（一）」（（一）（二）は返り点）とある。
sen.e: According to 'Matsu no ochiba' (a book on Shinto) written by Takanao FUJII, in the section of investiture of the Empress in 'Gokeshidai' (the Ritual Protocol of the Oe House), it is described that 'Two Shishi-shaped guardian dogs shall be placed on the left and right sides in front of the south face of chodai'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処漢文の部分は定訳不明です。
sen.e: According to 'Matsu no ochiba' (a book on Shinto) written by Takanao FUJII, in the section of investiture of the Empress in 'Gokeshidai' (the Ritual Protocol of the Oe House), it is described that 'Two Shishi-shaped guardian dogs shall be placed on the left and right sides in front of the south face of the chodai.'

According to 'Matsu no ochiba' (a book on Shinto) written by Takanao FUJII, in the section of investiture of the Empress in 'Gokeshidai' (the Ritual Protocol of the Oe House), it is described that 'Two Shishi-shaped guardian dogs shall be placed on the left and right sides in front of the south face of the chodai.'

sen.j: さらに、「栄花物語」布引滝巻で獅子舞のことを「しし狛犬」といっている。
sen.e: Furthermore, in the volume of Nunobiki no taki (Nunobiki falls) in 'Eiga monogatari' (A Tale of Flowering Fortunes), shishimai (lion dance) is referred to as 'Shishi komainu'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, in the volume of Nunobiki no taki (Nunobiki falls) in 'Eiga monogatari' (A Tale of Flowering Fortunes), shishimai (lion dance) is referred to as 'Shishi komainu.'
Furthermore, in the volume of Nunobiki no taki (Nunobiki falls) in 'Eiga monogatari' (A Tale of Flowering Fortunes), shishimai (lion dance) is referred to as 'Shishi komainu.'

sen.j: よって、狛犬も獅子であり、獅子と狛犬との2種ではない。
sen.e: These represent that the komainu was regarded as a sort of shishi lion and they were not divided into two kinds.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These represent that the komainu was regarded as a sort of shishi lion and they were not divided into two kinds.
These represent that the komainu was regarded as a sort of shishi lion and they were not divided into two kinds.

sen.j: かつ、「遊仙窟」の注に「以（レ）玉刻為（二）獅子（一）、安（二）牀頭（一）、避（二）鬼魅（一）、竝得（レ）鎮（二）押氈席（一）」（（一）（二）（レ）は返り点）とある。
sen.e: In addition, in the annotation of 'Yusenkutsu' (a Chinese novel by Chosaku in T'ang-Dynasty period), there is a description, 'To place stone-carved shishi lion in a bedroom is effective to avert monsters, goblins, and ghosts as well as to press the carpet'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処漢文の部分は定訳不明です。
sen.e: In addition, in the annotation of 'Yusenkutsu' (a Chinese novel by Chosaku in the Tang-Dynasty period), there is a description, 'To place stone-carved shishi lion in a bedroom is effective to avert monsters, goblins, and ghosts as well as to press the carpet.'

In addition, in the annotation of 'Yusenkutsu' (a Chinese novel by Chosaku in the Tang-Dynasty period), there is a description, 'To place stone-carved shishi lion in a bedroom is effective to avert monsters, goblins, and ghosts as well as to press the carpet.'

sen.j: これによって、この獅子形は、獅子の用をなすとどうじに鬼魅を避けるまじないとなるものであったろう、という。
sen.e: It is also said that this indicates that the shishi-shaped guardian dogs used this way played a role not only as ordinary shishi lion but also as a charm to avert monsters, goblins, and ghosts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also said that this indicates that the shishi-shaped guardian dogs used this way played a role not only as ordinary shishi lion but also as a charm to avert monsters, goblins, and ghosts.
It is also said that this indicates that the shishi-shaped guardian dogs used this way played a role not only as ordinary shishi lion but also as a charm to avert monsters, goblins, and ghosts.

sen.j: もし枕辺に太刀を置くならば柄を西に、刃を南に置く定めである。
sen.e: In case tachi (a sword) is placed at the bedside, the tsuka (hilt) must be put on the west side, and the blade must be put on the south side.
In case tachi (a sword) is placed at the bedside, the tsuka (hilt) must be put on the west side, and the blade must be put on the south side.
In case tachi (a sword) is placed at the bedside, the tsuka (hilt) must be put on the west side, and the blade must be put on the south side.

sen.j: 浜床その他の寸法などは「類聚雑要抄」4に詳しい。
sen.e: The details of the hamayuka and other information, such as its dimensions, are described in the fourth volume of 'ruijuzoyosho' (a book explaining the furnishings in ceremonies and events in detail with sketches).

The details of the hamayuka and other information, such as its dimensions, are described in the fourth volume of 'ruijuzoyosho' (a book explaining the furnishings in ceremonies and events in detail with sketches).

The details of the hamayuka and other information, such as its dimensions, are described in the fourth volume of 'ruijuzoyosho' (a book explaining the furnishings in ceremonies and events in detail with sketches).
